args:
After a dream, the prince visits the town of
Peng Lai. On the way, the party meets Su Fang,
a distraught pyroblossom firework technician
who is unable to craft more explosives due to
an incident at a nearby dragon-vein spring.
Afterward, the party decides to investigate.
You who hears my voice...\nI beseech you, grant my request...
Crisis comes to the town of Peng Lai.\nLeft unchecked, this danger may grow\nto menace the world entire.
I request aid...to save the village...\nand the very world itself...
*gasp* W-was that a dream?!\nIt was so vivid...
We oughta be rollin' into this\nPeng Lai place any time now.
I'm sorry to drag you all so far out here\nfor what was probably just a normal,\neveryday dream, but...
We cannot simply dismiss a possible\naugury if the world itself is at risk.
Cleo gets it! We're here 'cause we care,\nso stop with the apologizin' already.
The sky just lit up like a sunrise!\nAnd if I'm not mistaken, someone is\nfiring off projectiles from the ground.
Interesting. Let's go take a look.
Hmm... Just as I suspected, the coloration\nand power are completely insufficient.
That guy's got a bunch of tube-looking...\num...tubes all lying around him.\nYou think he's the one firing stuff off?
Er, I'm sorry if we startled you.\nWe're just curious what you're doing.
I was testing out prototype pyroblossoms.
Pyroblossoms. They are devices\nthat shoot into the sky and explode\ninto a flower-like blaze.
They are a specialty of my hometown,\nPeng Lai.
Well, ain't this fortunateâ€”we're tryin'\nto REACH Peng Lai! Mind showin' us\nthe way?
Yes, of course! Please follow me.
It's like we've stepped into a town\nfrom a completely different nation.

Ah, this must be your first time in
Peng Lai. It was built a century ago
by people who came here from the
eastern land of Taiwu.
As a result, the town's appearance and\nculture are all modeled after Taiwu.
Look at the decorations! And food carts!\nAnd souvenir stands! Aaaaugh!
It almost feels as if they are preparing\nfor some manner of festival.
You have quite the sharp eye, miss.\nWe're actually preparing for our annual\nfestival to celebrate the new year.
Er, I think you guys are a little late.

Ah, yes. You see, just as in Taiwu,
this village runs on a different calendar
from the rest of Alberia. We are roughly
a month behind where you are.
The new year we celebrate at this time\nis called the Lunar New Year.
We also observe your Alberian celebration,\nbut the Lunar New Year is much more\nimportant in this village.
Wait, so you get TWO New Year's parties?\nLUCKY! I WANNA LIVE HEEEERE!
Heh. While I cannot speak to that,\nyou're welcome to stay here and\nenjoy the festivities.

In fact, I have an idea. To commemorate
your coming to Peng Lai, let me treat you
to some spring rolls from that cart.
They are to die for, I assure you.
Ho there, Su Fang. You're just in time\nto taste my latest and greatest recipe,\nif you would be so kind.
It would be my pleasure. Would the\nrest of you like to try some as well?
Is that even a real question? Gimme!
Su Fang, I tried changing up the decoration\non the lanterns. What do you think?
Why, what splendid craftsmanship!\nThey will make our town even more lovely.
Try my new food as well, Su Fang!
It certainly seems like the people here\nall count on you, Su Fang.

Oh, it's nothing quite so important as that.
I just want the Lunar New Year to be fun
and exciting for everyone, so I have a
hand in various planning matters.

Don't be so modest! The jewel of the
Lunar New Year is your pyroblossom
displayâ€”we're really looking forward
to it!
Er, yes. Just...leave it to me.
Ah, Xiao Lei. What's the matter?
Weren't you the one who requested\nthat I undertake an investigation?
Ah, yes. So I did. Apologies.\nHave you learned anything?
I'll get right to the point: It will\nbe impossible to make your usual\npyroblossoms this year.
Don't say that kind of thing so loudly!\nWhat if someone were to hear you?!
Facts are facts, whether you\nhide them or not.
But everyone will be so disappointed!
Don't worryâ€”we ain't gonna say\nsquat about yer little problem.\nIn fact, I'm bettin' we'll help ya out!
That's right! Heck, we actually came here\nin the first place because we were warned\nto do so in some spooky dream.
Then you came here to...save us?
It's nothing so grand as that, but if there's\nanything we can do to help, we will.
I don't fully understand, but what's the\nharm in telling them? I don't think things\ncan get any worse than they are now.
In that case...will you hear me out?

The manufacture of pyroblossoms requires
an infusion of mana. Said mana causes
them to rocket up and erupt into massive,
flower-like shapes in the night sky.

We technicians create these displays
by manipulating the mana from nearby
dragon-vein springs and guiding it
into the pyroblossom.
That is what they are called both here\nand in Taiwuâ€”though you likely refer\nto them as mana founts.
Mana founts are notoriously tricky things.\nYou must have great skill indeed to be\nable to control such a flow.
Not enough, I fear, for I am currently\nunable to infuse this year's supply of\npyroblossoms with mana.
The dragon-vein spring near Peng Lai\nhas stopped flowing.
I didn't know that was possible!
Apparently soâ€”although I haven't\nactually seen it for myself.

It's merely a conclusion based on a
number of measurements. There yet
remains a weak flow of mana, but even
that will stop soon if something isn't done.
Which might be the danger that\n{player_name} dreamed about.

Mana founts are special placesâ€”one could
even call them the source of life itself.
The very idea of one drying up is nearly
unthinkable in normal circumstances.
Then it looks like we need to\nstart an investigation.
Wait! You must take me with you, please!\nI cannot simply stand by and do nothing\nafter hearing the town could be in danger.
And I wish to come as well.
You will need a guide to the dragon-vein\nspring if nothing else.
We'd be happy to have you both.\nNow come on, everybody!
